thread.title: Royals-Blue Jays projected lineups for Game 1 of ALCS
thread.title_full: Royals-Blue Jays projected lineups for Game 1 of ALCS

author: Jeff Deters
title: Royals-Blue Jays projected lineups for Game 1 of ALCS
text:
Royals-Blue Jays projected lineups for Game 1 of ALCS Morales has three homers, six RBIs in postseason for KC Posted: October 15, 2015 - 1:44pm Photos THE ASSOCIATED PRESS Kansas City Royals starting pitcher Edinson Volquez talks to the media during a news conference before batting practice for baseball's American League Championship Series Thursday in Kansas City, Mo. Volquez will start for the Royals as they face the Toronto Blue Jays in Game 1 Friday. By Jeff Deters jeff.deters@cjonline.com 
Hereâ€™s a look at the projected lineups for Game 1 of the American League Championship Series between the Kansas City Royals and Toronto Blue Jays. First pitch is 7:07 p.m. Friday at Kauffman Stadium in Kansas City, Mo. 
TORONTO BLUE JAYS 
P Player Avg. HR RBI 
LF Ben Revere .304 0 1 
3B Josh Donaldson .222 2 4 
RF Jose Bautista .273 2 5 
DH Edwin Encarnicion .333 1 3 
1B Chris Colabello .375 1 2 
SS Troy Tulowitzki .095 1 4 
C Russell Martin .200 0 1 
CF Kevin Pillar .333 1 4 
2B Ryan Goins .000 0 0 
KANSAS CITY ROYALS 
P Player Avg. HR RBI 
SS Alcides Escobar .286 0 0 
2B Ben Zobrist .333 0 2 
CF Lorenzo Cain .250 1 2 
1B Eric Hosmer .190 1 5 
DH Kendrys Morales .263 3 6 
3B Mike Moustakas .111 0 0 
C Salvador Perez .286 2 4 
LF Alex Gordon .235 1 2 
RF Alex Rios .286 0 2 
STARTING PITCHERS 
Blue Jays: TBA (0-0, 0.00 ERA) 
Royals: RHP Edinson Volquez (0-1, 4.76 ERA) 
Statistics are from 2015 postseason
